headline: 4-Day Workweek Brings No Loss of Productivity, Companies in Experiment Say

headline: Pandemic Unemployment Fraud Estimate Rises to $45.6 Billion

abstract: The S.E.C. said Boeing had misled investors by suggesting that human error was to blame for two deadly crashes, and omitting the company’s concerns about the plane.

abstract: Apple’s pursuit of an N.F.L. media package has broadened to include a sponsorship of one of TV’s most-watched events.

abstract: New boutique condo towers, some with fewer apartments than the buildings they replace, are squandering high-density sites in Manhattan, urban planners say.

abstract: Battling far-right extremism, Germany has gone further than any other Western democracy to prosecute individuals for what they say online, testing the limits of free speech on the internet.

abstract: Misleading and divisive posts about the Nov. 8 midterm vote have flooded social media. Here are three prevalent themes.

headline: Britain makes a risky bet on tax cuts to drive growth.

headline: Oil Prices Tumble to Their Lowest Level Since January
abstract: The U.S. benchmark oil price fell below $80 a barrel for the first time since the start of the year.

headline: Are You Finally Back in the Office? Tell Us How You’re Managing
abstract: For those who worked from home for two-and-a-half years and are only now returning to an office, an entire lifestyle needs to be undone or readjusted. We want to hear about it.

headline: Irwin Glusker, 98, Dies; Gave American Heritage Its Distinctive Look
abstract: A veteran art director, he was best known for his work at the lavish magazine of U.S. history that became a fixture in dens across the country.

abstract: The agreement, which headed off a strike last week, must still pass muster with union members.
